resources.string: I would like to share this ships map with you.
The PPM has been stored in the settings. The PPM which was found for your device is:
Not possible to automatically determine PPM. Are there ships in your area? Try it again or manually enter the PPM into the Settings.

To use another RTL-SDR device, the application will stop now. Insert the RTL-SDR device to start the app automagically. Afterwards make sure to enter the device specific PPM or use the calibrate utility to find it.

You have three options:

- Let this app try to calibrate the RTL-SDR device. For this you need to be in an area with (multiple) ships. (RECOMMENDED)

- Enter the known PPM value of your RTL-SDR device in the Settings,

- Don\'t use the RTL-SDR device at all / I don\'t have such a device. Receive from external device and/or fellow users only.
You will only receive Ships data from external sources. To re-enable the Calibrate utility, insert a supported RTL-SDR device.
Cancelled calibration of RTL-SDR device. You will only receive Ship data from fellow users.
Waiting for AIS data. Please be patient. After receiving data, the ship(s) will be plotted on the map.
USB host mode / OTG not supported at your device. You will only receive Ship data from fellow users.
You connected a USB device while the application is running. Currently this is not supported. Please restart application to start using the USB device. Application will stop now.

Do you mind to share ships data with fellow users?

You can change this later in settings.

WARNING: It is not in all regions allowed to repeat received ships data to third parties.
Ship data received from dongle, will be repeated to the cloud. You can change this in Settings.
Not possible to start Augmented Reality
This device does not support AR
Unable to get camera. Is another app using the camera?
Location and Camera permissions are needed to use this feature.
The locations of moving vessels depicted on the screen are not their exact locations. Vessels are not continuously sending their position, so more accurate data is simply not available.
The app needs location permission to plot your location on the map.
You denied location permission. The app won\'t function as expected.
You denied location permission. The app won\'t function as expected. Please grant permission via Settings-App-Ships-Permissions
This application is not compatible with your device.
You have not selected an RTL-SDR device.
No permission to open device, while requesting permission - Not possible to run this application without the right permissions. Sorry!
Not possible to connect to device. Is the device physically connected? Please insert RTL-SDR device before starting. You will only receive Ship data from fellow users.
Permission denied to open device - Not possible to run this application without the right permissions. Sorry!
Security exception occurred while opening USB device.
Unknown error while opening USB device.
Error occurred while stopping RTL-SDR device. Stopped already?"
RTL-SDR is running already. Must stop before started again.
Be verbose in displaying logging messages in the status bar.
On every update of a ship position, zoom the map so it will display all ships.
Don\'t make sound when a name of a ship is received the first time.
Pre fetch map tiles for lower zoomlevels. Will speed up zooming in and out, but will download more data and uses more disk storage.
Maximal disk storage used by the caching tiles server.
Scale factor of ships on map. Default value: 5
Change this value to let ships appear bigger/smaller on the map. Higher value, bigger ships.
Maximum age of ships on map. Default value: 20 minutes
Change this value to change the maximum age of a ship and its traces on the map.

This is an experimental feature, which is not available on all devices. When it is available, an AR-button will be shown at the map-view. When you press the button, the camera will be opened. Be sure to have at least one vessel in your view. In the view: the MMSI, the country flag and eventually the name will be shown. Click on the marker to view more information.
Change this value to show only ships which are within the specified distance range.
Remove ship from list of ships to render when last update is older than this value.
The RTL-SDR parts per million offset.
Use the calibrate utility to determine this automatically or set this value manually.
Let another (instance of) application send messages to this address. Generic NMEA format/UDP protocol.\nSettings will apply after restart of application.
Click to see local IP address
The UDP port this application is listening for NMEA.

Repeat received messages to fellow users of this app via cloud or peer-to-peer link, to third party plotter like OpenCPN, or to other interested party like MarineTraffic.

You can add up to 2 peer-to-peer repeaters.

WARNING: It is not in all regions allowed to repeat received ships data to third parties!
Settings will apply after restart of application.
Repeat received ships (AIS messages) FROM dongle (RTL-SDR).
Repeat received ships (AIS messages) FROM external source.
Repeat received ships (AIS messages) FROM fellow users of this app (cloud).
Repeat received ships (AIS messages) TO fellow users of this app (cloud).
Add an incoming Net/UDP connection in i.e. OpenCPN. Default: address 127.0.0.1 and port 10110.
The IP address to send received AIS messages to (peer-to-peer).
The UDP port to send received AIS messages to (peer-to-peer). To disable this repeater, enter 0 as value.
The IP address to send received AIS messages to (peer-to-peer).
The UDP port to send received AIS messages to (peer-to-peer). To disable this repeater, enter 0 as value.

Each RTL-SDR has it\'s unique parts per million offset (PPM). Use this utility to find the PPM for your device or set it directly using the settings of this application. Typical values PPM are between -100 and +100. Average calibration time is between 5 and 10 minutes. Please be patient.
GPS is not enabled. Enable GPS to view your current position at the map.

(please read the complete text by scrolling down)

Minimal requirements

You can use this app on a device with OTG-support and a so called RTL-SDR dongle connected, in an area where AIS data is available in the air. You must be allowed by local law to receive and process AIS signals.

The Ships development team (VIDEGRO) will not be held responsible for any legal issues that might be caused by usage or possession of the app. It is your responsibility to comply with your local law(s) before using Ships. Besides of that we are also not responsible for any issues like financial, raised by using this app and receiving faulty, incomplete and/or delayed information. We do not accept any claims of broken hardware (i.e. SDR-devices and Android devices) caused by this application.

Where could I buy a compatible RTL-SDR dongle?

Please search at eBay for \'RTL2832U\' price should be less than 10 euro. Besides of that you also need an OTG cable which is also not expensive at all.

Why should I use the Ships-app and not another Android-app which is displaying the ships data on a map?

Of course you are free to select your app, this app is however unique because:

- It does not need an Internet/data connection to receive ships data, it is receiving live / real data from air;
- It is not limited in number of ships;
- There is no extra delay added;
- No in app purchases: It is free of charge!

Can I use this app in my area/country? /
Is it allowed to use this app in my area/country?

This app works everywhere where you are able to receive AIS data. To show the maps you need to have a working data connection or cache the map data in advance. To receive the AIS data from air could be regulated by your local authorities.

Preparation

Before receiving ship data, you have to fill the dongle specific PPM value. In this app a calibrate utility is build in. You can use this utility only in an area with ships because the utility is using actual AIS data from ships. It is possible that this PPM value will change when your dongle is warming up. There is no clean solution build in this app to solve this problem, when you know the new value, you have to change the PPM by hand from the settings.

You can use this app without Internet/data connection. In this case maps are not loaded/refreshed. To use the app without Internet/data connection but with maps, prepare/cache your maps. To do so:

1. Make sure you have an Internet/data connection;
2. Navigate the map to the desired area and zoom manually all zoom-levels;
Your map-data should be cached now at your device.

Third party apps / OpenCPN

It is not the intention to rebuild an application like OpenCPN. The app is not so sophisticated as OpenCPN, instead this Android-app has a unique combination of three functionalities:

1. Calibration tool for the RTL-SDR dongle (determine dongle specific PPM value);
2. Receive AIS data directly from air on your Android device;
3. Plot the AIS data on a map at your Android device. Without delay, without extra paid options. All free of charge!

When you would like to use the full functionality of OpenCPN, this app is capable to relay the data to OpenCPN. In case you would like to run this Ships app and OpenCPN at the same device, just leave the settings in Ships-app untouched and create in OpenCPN an incoming connection at IP address 127.0.0.1 and UDP port 10110.

When you would like to run OpenCPN at another computer (desktop/laptop), change via the Settings the \'AIS messages destination host\' to the IP address of the computer which is running OpenCPN. Make sure the firewall at the computer which is running OpenCPN is accepting incoming UDP data at port 10110. In OpenCPN create an incoming connection at the IP address of the computer running OpenCPN and UDP port 10110. Caution: This IP address is NOT the IP address of your Android device when you are running OpenCPN on another device. Afterwards restart Ship-app to use the new settings. Of course UDP traffic should be routable from the Android-device to the computer running OpenCPN (wifi-network/Internet).

Bugs / Comments

In case you experience bugs or have comments, please contact the development team directly by posting a comment here, instead of posting negative feedback at the Google Play store. We will try to fix the problems as soon as possible.

More information

(press BACK to return to the app)
